h4801.definition: ; from {{h7368}}; remoteness, i.e. (concretely) a distant place; often (adverbially) from afar; (a-, dwell in, very) far (country, off). See also {{h1023}}.

h4803.definition: a primitive root; to polish; by implication, to make bald (the head), to gall (the shoulder); also, to sharpen; bright, furbish, (have his) hair (be) fallen off, peeled, pluck off (hair).

h4804.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h4803}}; to pull off; be plucked.

h4805.definition: from {{h4784}}; bitterness, i.e. (figuratively) rebellion; concretely, bitter, or rebellious; bitter, (most) rebel(-lion, -lious).

h4806.definition: from {{h4754}} in the sense of grossness, through the idea of domineering (compare {{h4756}}); stall-fed; often (as noun) a beeve; fat (fed) beast (cattle, -ling).

h4807.definition: from {{h7378}} and {{h1168}}; quarreller of Baal, Merib-Baal, an epithet of Gideon; Merib-baal. Compare {{h4810}}.

h4809.definition: the same as {{h4808}}; Meribah, the name of two places in the Desert; Meribah.

h4810.definition: from {{h4805}} and {{h1168}}; rebellion of (i.e. against) Baal; Meri-Baal, an epithet of Gideon; Meri-baal. Compare {{h4807}}.

h4811.definition: from {{h4784}}; rebellion; Merajah, an Israelite; Meraiah. Compare {{h3236}}.

h4812.definition: plural of {{h4811}}; rebellious; Merajoth, the name of two Israelites; Meraioth.

h4813.definition: from {{h4805}}; rebelliously; Mirjam, the name of two Israelitesses; Miriam.

h4816.definition: perhaps from {{h7401}}; softness, i.e. (figuratively) fear; faintness.

h4817.definition: from {{h7392}}; a chariot; also a seat (in a vehicle); chariot, covering, saddle.

h4818.definition: feminine of {{h4817}}; a chariot; chariot. See also {{h1024}}.

h4820.definition: from {{h7411}} in the sense of deceiving; fraud; craft, deceit(-ful, -fully), false, feigned, guile, subtilly, treachery.

h4821.definition: the same as {{h4820}}; Mirmah, an Israelite; Mirma.

h4822.definition: plural from {{h7311}}; heights; Meremoth, the name of two Israelites; Meremoth.

h4823.definition: from {{h7429}}; abasement (the act or the thing); tread (down) -ing, (to be) trodden (down) under foot.

h4824.definition: patrial from an unused noun; a Meronothite, or inhabitant of some (otherwise unknown) Meronoth.; Meronothite.

h4825.definition: of foreign derivation; Meres, a Persian; Meres.

h4826.definition: of foreign derivation; Marsena, a Persian; Marsena.

h4827.definition: from {{h7489}}; used as (abstract) noun, wickedness; do mischief.

h4828.definition: from {{h7462}} in the sense of companionship; a friend; companion, friend.

h4829.definition: from {{h7462}} in the sense of feeding; pasture (the place or the act); also the haunt of wild animals; feeding place, pasture.

h4830.definition: from {{h7462}} in the sense of feeding; pasturage; concretely, a flock; flock, pasture.

h4831.definition: from {{h7477}}; perhaps, earthquake; Maralah, a place in Palestine; Maralah.

h4832.definition: from {{h7495}}; properly, curative, i.e. literally (concretely) a medicine, or (abstractly) a cure; figuratively (concretely) deliverance, or (abstractly) placidity; (in-)cure(-able), healing(-lth), remedy, sound, wholesome, yielding.

h4833.definition: from {{h7515}}; muddled water; that which...have fouled.

h4834.definition: a primitive root; properly, to press, i.e. (figuratively) to be pungent or vehement; to irritate; embolden, be forcible, grievous, sore.

h4838.definition: a primitive root; to polish; by implication, to sharpen; also to rinse; bright, furbish, scour.

h4839.definition: from {{h4838}}; soup (as if a rinsing); broth. See also {{h6564}}.

h4841.definition: feminine of {{h4840}}; abstractly, a seasoning (with spicery); concretely, an unguentkettle (for preparing spiced oil); pot of ointment, × well.

h4842.definition: from {{h7543}}; an aromatic unguent; also an unguent-pot; prepared by the apothecaries' art, compound, ointment.

h4843.definition: a primitive root; properly, to trickle (see {{h4752}}); but used only as a denominative from {{h4751}}; to be (causatively, make) bitter (literally or figuratively); (be, be in, deal, have, make) bitter(-ly, -ness), be moved with choler, (be, have sorely, it) grieved(-eth), provoke, vex.

h4844.definition: or מְרוֹר; from {{h4843}}; a bitter herb; bitter(-ness).

h4846.definition: or מְרוֹרָה; from {{h4843}}; properly, bitterness; concretely, a bitter thing; specifically bile; also venom (of a serpent); bitter (thing), gall.

h4847.definition: from {{h4843}}; bitter; Merari, an Israelite; Merari. See also {{h4848}}.

h4848.definition: from {{h4847}}; a Merarite (collectively), or descendants of Merari; Merarites.

h4849.definition: from {{h7561}}; a female wicked doer; wicked woman.

h4850.definition: dual of {{h4751}} feminine; double bitterness; Merathajim, an epithet of Babylon; Merathaim.

h4851.definition: of foreign derivation; Mash, a son of Aram, and the people descended from him; Mash.

h4852.definition: of foreign derivation; Mesha, a place in Arabia; Mesha.

h4853.definition: from {{h5375}}; a burden; specifically, tribute, or (abstractly) porterage; figuratively, an utterance, chiefly a doom, especially singing; mental, desire; burden, carry away, prophecy, × they set, song, tribute.

h4854.definition: the same as {{h4853}}; burden; Massa, a son of Ishmael; Massa.

h4855.definition: from {{h5383}}; a loan; by implication, interest on a debt; exaction, usury.

h4856.definition: from {{h5375}}; partiality (as a lifting up); respect.

h4857.definition: from {{h7579}}; a trough for cattle to drink from; place of drawing water.

h4858.definition: from {{h5375}}; a conflagration (from the rising of smoke); burden.

h4859.definition: feminine of {{h4855}}; a loan; × any(-thing), debt.

h4861.definition: from {{h7592}}; request; Mishal, a place in Palestine; Mishal, Misheal. Compare {{h4913}}.

h4863.definition: from {{h7604}} in the original sense of swelling; a kneading-trough (in which the dough rises); kneading trough, store.

h4864.definition: from {{h5375}}; properly, (abstractly) a raising (as of the hands in prayer), or rising (of flame); figuratively, an utterance; concretely, a beacon (as raised); a present (as taken), mess, or tribute; figuratively, a reproach (as a burden); burden, collection, sign of fire, (great) flame, gift, lifting up, mess, oblation, reward.

h4865.definition: from {{h7660}}; a brocade; by analogy, a (reticulated) setting of a gem; ouch, wrought.

h4866.definition: from {{h7665}}; the orifice of the womb (from which the fœtus breaks forth); birth, breaking forth.

h4867.definition: from {{h7665}}; a breaker (of the sea); billow, wave.

h4869.definition: from {{h7682}}; properly, a cliff (or other lofty or inaccessible place); abstractly, altitude; figuratively, a refuge; Misgab, a place in Moab; defence, high fort (tower), refuge, Misgab.

h4871.definition: a primitive root; to pull out (literally or figuratively); draw(out).

h4872.definition: from {{h4871}}; drawing out (of the water), i.e. rescued; Mosheh, the Israelite lawgiver; Moses.

h4875.definition: or מְשֹׁאָה; from the same as {{h7722}}; (a) ruin, abstractly (the act) or concretely (the wreck); desolation, waste.

h4876.definition: or מַשֻּׁאָה; for {{h4875}}; ruin; desolation, destruction.

h4877.definition: from {{h7725}}; returned; Meshobab, an Israelite; Meshobab.

h4878.definition: or מְשֻׁבָה; from {{h7725}}; apostasy; backsliding, turning away.

h4879.definition: from an unused root meaning to stray; mistake; error.

h4880.definition: or מִשּׁוֹט; from {{h7751}}; an oar; oar.

h4881.definition: or מְשֻׂכָה; from {{h7753}}; a hedge; hedge.

h4882.definition: from an unused root meaning to plunder; spoilation; spoil.

h4883.definition: from an unused root meaning to rasp; a saw; saw.

h4884.definition: from an unused root meaning apparently to divide; a measure (for liquids); measure.

h4885.definition: from {{h7797}}; delight, concretely (the cause or object) or abstractly (the feeling); joy, mirth, rejoice.

h4886.definition: a primitive root; to rub with oil, i.e. to anoint; by implication, to consecrate; also to paint; anoint, paint.

h4887.definition: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to {{h4886}}; oil; oil.

h4888.definition: or מׇשְׁחָה; from {{h4886}}; unction (the act); by implication, a consecratory gift; (to be) anointed(-ing), ointment.

h4889.definition: from {{h7843}}; destructive, i.e. (as noun) destruction, literally (specifically a snare) or figuratively (corruption); corruption, (to) destroy(-ing), destruction, trap, × utterly.

h4891.definition: from {{h7836}} in the sense of day breaking; dawn; morning.

h4893.definition: or מׇשְׁחָת; from {{h7843}}; disfigurement; corruption, marred.

h4894.definition: or מִשְׁטַח; from {{h7849}}; a spreading-place; (to) spread (forth, -ing, upon).

h4895.definition: from the same as {{h7850}}; enmity; hatred.

h4897.definition: from {{h4871}}; silk (as drawn from the cocoon); silk.

h4898.definition: from an equiv. to {{h7804}} and {{h410}}; delivered of God; Meshezabel, an Israelite; Meshezabeel.

h4899.definition: from {{h4886}}; anointed; usually a consecrated person (as a king, priest, or saint); specifically, the Messiah; anointed, Messiah.

h4900.definition: a primitive root; to draw, used in a great variety of applications (including to sow, to sound, to prolong, to develop, to march, to remove, to delay, to be tall, etc.); draw (along, out), continue, defer, extend, forbear, × give, handle, make (pro-, sound) long, × sow, scatter, stretch out.
